node.title: Musk's Starlink may provide permanent internet solution for some Tongan islands
node.description: A team of workers from Elon Musk's SpaceX are in Fiji trying to re-establish full internet communications in Tonga, with a Starlink broadband connection. Audio

node.title: Emergency departments expect huge pressures from Omicron - specialist
node.description: Latest modelling by Covid-19 Modelling Aotearoa suggests a peak of 800 people in hospital on any given day at best, but well over 3000 at worst. Audio

node.title: National Future Energy Centre progress questioned
node.description: In its first year of operation Ara Ake - the national future energy centre - burnt through two thirds of its annual revenue, that's $1.7m, in salaries, directors fees and consultants.

node.title: Norma Waterson, a Key Figure in Britainâ€™s Folk Revival, Dies at 82
node.description: With her familial singing group, the Watersons, and later as a solo performer, she helped revitalize traditional music from the north of England.

node.title: U.S. setting up expedited processing hub in Qatar for Afghans
node.description: The program will be based in a U.S. Army base in Qatar where eligible evacuees will be taken to complete interviews with U.S. officials, medical checks and security screenings.

node.title: Mask mandates create litter, hurting animals and environment
node.description: "Let's make sure ... we're not digging up gardens in years to come and finding masks," one researcher said.

node.title: The $8,000 child tax credit that parents may not know about
node.description: The American Rescue Plan gave a one-year boost to a tax credit aimed at helping parents who pay for child care.

node.title: J&J said to quietly halt COVID-19 vaccine production
node.description: The drugmaker reportedly closed the Dutch plant that was making the vaccine to focus on a different drug.

node.title: Weather: High humidity has Aucklanders hot and bothered
node.description: If you're finding yourself clammy, sweaty and breathing heavily into your face mask when you're out and about at the moment, you're not alone. Audio

node.title: Adverse weather events among reasons for Suncorp's half-year profit drop
node.description: One of the country's largest insurance groups, Suncorp, has reported a sharp fall in its half year profit on the back of increased claims and lower investment returns.

node.title: File a tax return to get the rest of the Child Tax Credit, officials say
node.description: Families who received monthly payments in the second half of last year can still get up to $1,800 for children younger than 6 and $1,500 for children ages 6 to 17 as part of their refund.

node.title: South Auckland primary schools consider onsite vaccination clinics
node.description: South Auckland primary schools are considering whether to host vaccine clinics to help vaccinate the region's 5 to 11-year-olds.

node.title: Male enhancement pill sold on Amazon is recalled
node.description: Product found to be tainted with unapproved drug for treatment of male erectile dysfunction, FDA says.

node.title: Scientists say they've developed a COVID test that works in 4 minutes
node.description: Researchers say their test is as accurate as PCR lab tests, which are highly accurate but usually take several hours to carry out.

node.title: Giving flowers or chocolate for Valentine's Day? Prepare to pay more.
node.description: Inflation and supply-chain problems are making it more expensive to show your love this year.

node.title: Conscience vote on conversion therapy in step with National traditions - Luxon
node.description: The National caucus now recognises that a conscience vote is the right approach for the second reading of the bill, new leader Christopher Luxon says.

node.title: Roycom hearing into St John of God abuse at Marylands School opens
node.description: The treatment of boys with learning disabilities by a Catholic religious order over a nearly 30-year period comes under the spotlight of the Abuse in Care inquiry starting today.

node.title: Firefighters blacklist aerial truck plagued with faults
node.description: Firefighters are refusing to work on a fire truck left stranded without power to its big ladder at a blaze that destroyed a Wellington house last week.

node.title: House building costs surge, 'plenty more' growth likely
node.description: Residential construction costs are rising at their fastest pace in four years with further increases expected.

node.title: Emhoff rushed out of high school event over reported security threat
node.description: A Secret Service agent rushed the second gentleman from an event at a Washington, D.C., high school.

node.title: McConnell, GOP senators criticize RNC for censuring Cheney, Kinzinger
node.description: "That's not the job of the RNC," the Senate minority leader said Tuesday.

node.title: Ministry statement on rapid antigen test requisition 'unclear' - Hipkins
node.description: A ministry statement admitting rapid antigen tests in the government's order were already in the country has led to incorrect conclusions, the minister says. Audio

node.title: Maryland Governor Larry Hogan says he will not run for Senate
node.description: Hogan, a popular Republican governor, had been lobbied by party leaders to challenge Democratic Senator Chris Van Hollen.

node.title: New flood system in Buller would give 8 hours advanced evacuation warning
node.description: The final piece of equipment for a new flood monitoring system is now in place in Buller River.

node.title: Southland leaders say Tiwai Point decision hopeful - for now
node.description: Rio Tinto has signalled it hopes to keep operating Tiwai Point aluminium smelter beyond 2024, the Southland Chamber of Commerce says.

node.title: Service members forced to "play God" amid chaotic Afghan withdrawal, Army investigation details
node.description: The Army investigation into the August 26 Abbey Gate attack at the Kabul airport included interviews with over 130 people.

node.title: Economic development agency launches new app to pair employers with talent
node.description: Whanganui city's economic development agency wants to see locals swiping right on a new matchmaking app set up to pair local businesses with skilled workers.

node.title: Amazon doubles salary cap to $350,000 for corporate workers
node.description: The move comes amid a red-hot job market for tech workers, with Apple recently giving some workers surprise six-figure bonuses.

node.title: Anne Neill was an inconspicuous 1950s housewife. She was also an undercover spy
node.description: The Adelaide widow was a Communist Party delegate who visited the Soviet Union and met KGB spy Vladimir Petrov. She was also an ASIO secret agent.

node.title: Kiwi 'can-do' attitude catching us out on the water
node.description: The Detail - New Zealanders are over-confident in the water, surf lifesavers say, something that's contributing to our shocking drowning statistics.
